Description.val: This system is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans and is required for National Command and Control capability. Funding provides for the procurement and installation of Integrated Waveform (IW) and Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) Digital Modular Radio (DMR) systems and IW and MUOS upgrade kits. DMR with IW and MUOS hardware is a four-channel software defined radio that provides satellite communications, Line of Sight (LOS) and High Frequency (HF), Very High Frequency (VHF) and Ultra High Frequency (UHF) communication capability to surface, submarine, and shore facilities. This variant of the DMR, including upgrade kits, provides hardware with IW/MUOS capability.

Justification.val:
The FY21 funding request was reduced by $5.522 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

The FY 2021 funding provides for the procurement of 10 DMR IW & MUOS Systems and 15 DMR IW & MUOS Upgrade Kits, and 52 installations (16 Afloat Systems, 9 Shore Systems, and 27 Upgrade Kits). In addition, FY 2021 includes funding to implement cybersecurity upgrades and cryptographic modernization to increase system performance and security for fielded DMRs.

Name.val: 2.1) DMR IW and MUOS System Production Support

Name.@footnote: Pre-Installation Design Services Allocation (DSA) are required in order to complete ship check and installation drawings for installation planning and is performed 6-12 months prior to installation start.  Post Installation DSA support requirements include system operational verification tests (SOVT) and system drawings closeout requirements.  DSA costs will fluctuate each FY as it is a factor of the number of installations in any given fiscal year.  In FY 2021, $1.163 million funds SOVTs and design closeout for sixteen (16) FY 2021 installations, $2.955 million funds the pre-installation planning for eleven (11) FY 2022 installations, and $0.604 million funds the SOVT and design closeout for three (3)FY 2021 shore installations.
Name.val: 2.2) DMR IW and MUOS System DSA

Name.@footnote: a) The combination of configurations purchased in FY 2021 gives the appearance of an average unit cost decrease.  FY 2021 is procuring 4 less large deck (LCC/LHD/CVN) systems than in FY 2020 ($3.890 million/system).  Large-deck platforms require 3 Digital modular Radios (DMR) and have more associated ancillary equipment required, compared to 1 DMR radio for all other configurations.  b) Due to late contract definitization, the FY 2018 procurement was delayed and occurred at the same time with the FY 2019 procurement in February 2019.  Following a 19-month lead time and production delivery schedule, these procurements will be installing in FY 2021.  c) The FY2021 installation unit cost increases due to the combination of configurations being installed.

Description.val:
Integrated Waveform (IW) and Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) Digital Modular Radio (DMR) Systems.  Quantities between radios and kits may change from year to year as a result of ship availabilities and fleet priority.

[DMR IW and MUOS System Procurement - Afloat] FY 2021 funding provides for ten (10 QTY) DMR IW & MUOS afloat systems. 

DMR IW & MUOS system annual unit cost variances for procurements and installations are driven by system configurations.  There are 3 different DMR IW & MUOS System afloat configurations (2 surface & 1 subsurface) and 5 different DMR IW & MUOS Upgrade Kit afloat configurations (3 surface & 2 subsurface).  Additionally, shore sites do not have a standard configuration and are unique to each individual shore site.  For shore, the budget reflects individual radios vice afloat configurations. 

For the DMR IW & MUOS System, the configuration ranges from 1 - 3 DMR radios and requires a unique set of ancillary equipment dependent upon ship class (racks, power amplifiers & antenna upgrades).  For example, a CVN requires 3 DMR radios and would need 4 racks to complete installation.  When compared to a DDG, which needs only 1 DMR radio and 2 racks to complete installation.  One (1) DMR system will range in cost depending on the type of configuration and Economic Order Quantity Pricing relevant at time of contract award. 

The nineteen (19) month Production Lead Time (PLT) for DMR System delivery is due to varying PLT's from multiple ancillary equipment vendors that are then integrated into the final product.  Ancillary equipment is provided to Naval Information Warfare Center (NIWC) Pacific for integration, assembly and test.  The seven (7) month Administrative Lead Time (ALT) for DMR System procurements allows for the identification and receipt of other customer funds in order to take advantage of favorable quantity pricing.

ModificationTitle.val: (DN 111) DMR IW and MUOS Upgrade Kits

Name.val: 2.1) DMR IW and MUOS Upgrade Kits Production Support

Name.@footnote: Pre-Installation Design Services Allocation (DSA) are required in order to complete ship check and installation drawings for installation planning and is performed 6-12 months prior to installation start.  Post Installation DSA support requirements include drawings closeout.  DSA costs will fluctuate each FY as it is a factor of the number of installations in any given fiscal year.  In FY 2021, $1.098 million funds SOVTs and design closeout for twenty-seven (27) FY 2021 installations.
Name.val: 2.2) DMR IW and MUOS Upgrade Kits DSA

Title.val: (DN 111) DMR IW and MUOS Upgrade Kits

Name.@footnote: a) Unit Cost variances for procurements are driven by afloat upgrade kit configurations and ancillary equipment (racks, power amplifiers & antenna upgrades), which is dependent upon ship class.  There are 5 different Digital Modular Radio (DMR) Integrated Waveform (IW) & Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) Upgrade Kit afloat configurations (3 surface & 2 subsurface) where each configuration ranges from 1 - 3 DMR upgrade kits and a unique set of ancillary equipment.  b) Due to late contract definitization, the FY 2018 procurement was delayed and occurred at the same time with the FY 2019 procurement in February 2019.  Following a 19-month lead time and production delivery schedule, these procurements will be installing in FY 2021.
Name.val: 1.1.1) DMR IW and MUOS Upgrade Kits Procurement - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) include Win 10 and cryptographic modernization.  FY 2019-2021 procures and installs Win 10 upgrades and performs associated integration, assembly and test.  FY 2019-2021 includes engineering changes associated with cryptographic modernization as directed by National Security Agency (NSA).  DMRs current embedded cryptographic systems will no longer be able to communicate securely after Crypto Keys expire due to cease key dates as directed by NSA.  In order to ensure warfighters continued secure (i.e. encrypted) communications, DMRs must modernize their cryptographic capabilities by implementing the latest algorithms.
Production lead time for upgrade kits is reduced from 19 months to 12 month due to completion of non-recurring costs in FY19.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Method:: Installation Name: DMR MUOS Upgrade Kits

Description.val:
This system is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans and is required for National Command and Control capability.  Integrated Waveform (IW) and Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) Digital Modular Radio (DMR) Upgrade Kits.  Quantities between radios and kits may change from year to year as a result of ship availabilities and fleet priority.

[DMR IW and MUOS Upgrade Kits Procurement] FY 2021 funding provides for fifteen (15 QTY) DMR IW & MUOS afloat upgrade kits.  In addition, Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) are required to implement cybersecurity upgrades and cryptographic modernization to increase system performance and security for fielded Digital Modular Radios (DMRs). 

DMR IW & MUOS upgrade kit annual unit cost variances for procurements and installations are driven by system configurations.  There are 3 different DMR IW & MUOS System afloat configurations (2 surface & 1 subsurface) and 5 different DMR IW & MUOS Upgrade Kit afloat configurations (3 surface & 2 subsurface).  Additionally, shore sites do not have a standard configuration and are unique to each individual shore site.  For shore, the budget reflects individual radios vice afloat configurations. 

For the DMR IW & MUOS Upgrade Kit, the configuration ranges from 1 - 3 DMR upgrade kits and requires a unique set of ancillary equipment dependent upon ship class (racks, power amplifiers & antenna upgrades).  DMR upgrade kit cost will vary depending on the type of configuration and Economic Order Quantity Pricing relevant at time of contract award. 

The twelve (12) month Production Lead Time (PLT) for DMR Upgrade Kit delivery is due to varying PLT's from multiple ancillary equipment vendors that are then integrated into the final product.  Ancillary equipment is provided to Naval Information Warfare Center (NIWC) Pacific, formally SPAWAR Systems Center (SSC) Pacific, for integration, assembly and test.  The seven (7) month Administrative Lead Time (ALT) for DMR Upgrade Kit procurements allows for the identification and receipt of other customer funds in order to take advantage of favorable quantity pricing.
